name: Draconic France
startIntroPart1: Also known as Jeanne Alter (ジャンヌ・オルタ, Jan'nu Oruta?), she represents the Alter counterpart of Jeanne d'Arc.
startIntroPart2: However, being designated as an 'Alter' does not indicate a mere alternate aspect of Jeanne d'Arc. Instead, she represents the embodiment of vengeance attributed to Gilles de Rais, the French Army's marshal who grieved for Jeanne d'Arc's death, fabricated by means of the Holy Grail shortly after Jeanne's execution in 1431. As a Heroic Spirit and dark counterpart of the actual Jeanne, she was originally summoned by Gilles in the Ruler class, but can be later summoned by Chaldea in the Avenger class
declaringWar: Your sins have piled enough–allow me to burn them away.
attacked: Hah! So the righteous come crawling to their pyre.
defeated: Even flames die... but my hatred never will.
denounced: Spare me your sanctimony; your words reek of hypocrisy.
introduction: I am Jeanne d'Arc... or rather, what your god abandoned. Do you still dare speak His name before me?
neutralHello: You tread lightly, as if afraid I'll ignite you. Wise.
hateHello: Back again? Do you crave the flames that much?
tradeRequest: Hmph. Even I see value in mutual gain... for now.
uniqueText: Revenge upon the world is a must. Avenge yourself and burn the world with your Dragons.

name: Roman Empire
startIntroPart2: The Fifth Roman Emperor. She had the reputation of a notorious tyrant whose rule was made up of schemes and poison as she oppressed all religious forces, especially Christians, and the Roman Senate during the period from 50 to 60 AD.
declaringWar: The stage is set, and I, Nero Claudius, shall claim the spotlight of victory!
attacked: How dare you interrupt my grand performance! Guards!
defeated: Ah... Even the brightest star must set. Remember my radiance...
denounced: Fufu, jealousy does not suit you. Only Rome may judge me!
introduction: I am Nero Claudius Caesar Augustus Germanicus! Bask in the glory of my magnificence!
neutralHello: Ah, a guest of Rome! Come, let us speak amid splendor.
hateHello: Back to test my patience again? Very well—Rome endures!
tradeRequest: A fair exchange! Let this transaction be as dazzling as my beauty!
uniqueText: Bedazzle the whole world with your talents.
uniques: [+25]% Production towards any buildings that already exist in the Capital

name: Divine Britannia
startIntroPart2: She is the alternate form of Artoria Pendragon from a Parallel World where Bedivere never returned Excalibur to the Lady of the Lake after the Battle of Camlann
declaringWar: You stand against providence itself. I shall erase your distortion.
defeated: So even the light... may fall to shadow.
denounced: Blasphemy. You dare cast judgement upon the pillar that sustains your world?
introduction: I am the Lance that anchors this world—Rhongomyniad. Kneel, and be still.
neutralHello: Mortal. State your purpose befor ethe eternal light.
hateHello: Yo persist in your defiance. I shall end your delusion soon enough.
tradeRequest: If this exchange preserves order, it shall be permitted.
uniqueName: Rhongomyniad: The Lance That Shines to the End of the World.
uniqueText: The anchor of storm that fastens the planet together.

name: Ancient Babylonia
startIntroPart2: The supreme wise king who returned from the journey of immortality. In legends, he has been described as “the one who saw everything”. At times ruthless, at times approving of human nature; the great king of Uruk who strictly led the masses.[2] Upon returning from his search for immortality, he found UrukWP in a decaying state due to his negligence. Since then he has dedicated himself to repairing and maintaining his kingdom, assisted by the chief priestess, Siduri.
declaringWar: How amusing. You truly believe you can contest the wisdom of Uruk?
attacked: Hmph. Insolence! Do you even grasp whose temple you strike?
defeated: Heh... so even I... can misjudge the worth of an opponent.
denounced: Bold words from one unfit to polish the gates of Uruk.
introduction: I am Gilgamesh, King of Heroes and sage of Uruk. Try not to bore me.
neutralHello: Hm? Ah, a visitor. Speak quickly—my tablets await.
hateHello: Still alive? Truly, the gods await my patience.
tradeRequest: Hmph. A transaction? Very well—bring something worthy of a king's gaze.
uniques: No Maintenance costs for improvements in [Fort] tiles
